comments.author: nrk1216

comments.text: I love this ad,it isn't meant to be a mainstream audience ad: it's meant to create BUZZ about "what the hell is that strange ad from Verizon?! it's spooky! THAT's buzz,mindshare. And for those who have been waiting for this phone, it's to amp up demand.A brilliant "teaser ad" in a campaign to saturate the crowded touchscreen marketplace with sudden awareness everywhere you turn to this new phone available out of the blue- causes the feeling: "wait. what about that﻿ new thing? It MUST be special"
comments.author: quicksite

comments.text: "When it really isn't". Have you seen the specs, screen size & resolution, full qwerty keyboard, how thin it is, running android 2.0 .... You clearly pulled﻿ that comment out of your ass.
comments.author: quicksite

comments.text:
You don't understand the art & science of advertising. It's rarely literal. In the case of Apple, it is, and they execute that superbly. Most advertising is to inject an emotion in audience, and associate that emotion with a name. That's it. It's all aimed at the subconscious.

To that end, this is a brilliant﻿ teaser campaign that simply creates the emotion "wtf? what was THAT from Verizon". With teaser campaigns, they ALWAYS follow up with the next ad series which delivers the sell message.

comments.author: desaraev6

comments.text:
"Reak - Stealth﻿ fighter. Some of the fastest planes"
A-10   500mph
F-16   1560 mph
F-14A Tomcat  1603 mph
F-15 Eagle   1560 mph
F/A 18 Hornet  1180 mph
F-117 NightHawk  Mach 0.98  or 745 MPH
**************************************************
745 is the 2nd slowest aircraft here. It has to go slow as not to cause too much heat. The F-117 stealth in this video is a very SLOW aircraft, NOT "some of the fastest".
Please look up US Fighter Jet Mach Numbers and then convert them to MPH.
